document.title: Quick Glance Checklist: 2020 NC ELD Standard Course of Study

AD348930BDAD46F2B1DD493769B1571D.description: Show relationships between claim, evidence, and reasoning

40E7849D3E1C4CB4A01FF6B5E1A54E7E.description: Select relevant information to support claims with evidence from one or more sources

400D247912404E2B8B3CCA444D8CFEA5.description: Argue.Expressive: Construct social studies arguments that:

CB8829068EC04419879AB10CCCDDD345.description: Evaluating source credibility based on distinctions between fact and opinion

A75CCCD9554844F1A8CBB2149B336A28.description: Analyzing relevant information from one or two sources to develop claims in response to compelling questions

F0868098E87B4E8FA734F3503FF5E829.description: Identifying topic and purpose (argue in favor or against a position, present a balanced interpretation, challenge perspective)

754A6BB162CE4CD69B50DA40CA7DD7E2.description: Argue.Interpretive: Interpret social studies arguments by:

E74189B0F78D4E83961CD4FE96FFBCBB.description: Generalize possible reasons for a development or event

AE01EBC3337A4CD8B86C76DF928E1C79.description: Describe components, order, causes, or cycles

4B451C5319D243B483B6A67404CD22A7.description: Explain.Expressive: Construct social studies explanations that:

D2045B50C6C741B3ADE7B0DC4CFF5C6C.description: Evaluating disciplinary concepts and ideas associated with a compelling or supporting question

7E57801B913149F1B322482B96FC2A2E.description: Analyzing sources for event sequences and/or causes/effects

21E77987A9AD49A99C37B29ABD3A3909.description: Determining types of sources for answering compelling and supporting questions about phenomena or events

938ADB511AEF4B9DA0CF52A79FCCAABD.description: Explain.Interpretive Interpret social studies explanations by:

67421B46799F4282874BD151C1EC467B.description: Signal logical relationships among reasoning, evidence, data, and/or a model when making a claim

7F543D06BBB14F2B948FB15E6E2DA104.description: Make a claim supported by relevant evidence

10ADDA3589944C5FA84F9C520A21E438.description: Introduce topic/phenomenon for an issue related to the natural and designed world(s)

471F234BB486455B9A5FAC355B41F49A.description: Analyzing whether evidence is relevant or not

BC9FDBF0E93146FEB4E2465A94EFD365.description: Identifying potential evidence from data, models, and/or information from investigations of phenomena or design solutions

FD225F5E96554BD890CA85009597F722.description: Compare multiple solutions to a problem considering how well they meet the criteria and

2F5E1096BE324A3E8FDC1EE9646B60CE.description: Develop a logical sequence between data or evidence and claim

A1D2498BED6D40F5BD56B8E36899D406.description: Describe observations and/or data about a phenomenon

8A416D38077B46CAB0F28AB6E658A896.description: Identifying information from observations as well as evidence that supports particular points in explanations

E593A69E67A84DD685244497FBE35B1B.description: Obtaining and combining information from observations, and using evidence to help explain how or why a phenomenon occurs

C91F1B84C5024D91A2D6737C242FAA4C.description: Defining investigable questions or simple design problems based on observations, data, and prior knowledge about a phenomenon

6D59C6990D6B489CB3BBCE9C646C400A.description: Identify and respond to others’ arguments

72182DABB71F41968D183A0FCD463481.description: Justify conclusion steps and strategies in simple patterns

AF8C2E8309A74B3FB1BF86FCAB06DA7A.description: Extracting mathematical operations and facts from solution strategies to create generalizations

89EBACB14BC4483B9DF53A9BBA1A9FEC.description: Distinguishing connections among ideas in justifications

DE5E6BF40BEC443E9CCC958121986529.description: Identifying conjectures about what might be true

630CBC03FB4A444AB13E1F095268EE3D.description: State reasoning used to generate solution

30A7FAE88553499EABD59D6AC7DED377.description: Describe solution and steps used to solve problem with others

FAF4B6461FB84897981791F2442800DC.description: Develop coherence and cohesion throughout text

A79B9441B91343EEA4F75E2EFA0EC4B5.description: Add details to define, describe, compare, and classify topic and/or entity

CA130EDDE78E4B599BED114D1A89C78B.description: Introduce and define topic and/or entity for audience

9D9F0CE92EDA4CD4AF4FFAB13D1EE06C.description:
Inform.Expressive: Construct informational texts in language arts (with prompting
and support) that:

8D82FDCFAD8A4ABA8E2814F29C366C04.description: Describing relationship between a series of events, ideas or concepts, or procedural steps

1CE3B6FCCE9F4566A7DFB4EB0579C03F.description: Referring explicitly to descriptions for themes and relationships among meanings

1C93F538726A40799187CB0DF7CC0641.description: Identifying the main idea and key details

99DAEB1852964C9DA019F076B29E0AC5.description:
Inform.Interpretive: Interpret informational texts in language arts (with prompting
and support) by:

32E93DC0306B49FBAF778AAE21C3C9C1.description: Develop story with time and event sequences, complication, resolution, or ending

1D7C6CFEFBC647E184477499B3FC4913.description:
Narrate.Expressive: Construct language arts narratives (with prompting and support)
that:

C4DE9FA723774D9CA02E2EA93D37B0FA.description: Determining the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in texts, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language

F659AFFD755F4169A17707C734B7EB23.description: Identifying how character attributes and actions contribute to event sequences

6063F4715CA448F49394EE18573DAD6B.description: Identifying a central message from key details

6205B9DD208C4407B6FE72F0640396DC.description:
Narrate.Interpretive: Interpret language arts narratives (with prompting and support)
by:

B1C4260B2F074327B0EAE7C7F04B02B1.description: Revise one’s own opinions based on new information

05AE61D7F93642D69C9736F8C83B93B6.description: Defend change in one’s own thinking

64718B28689A4AE69C6276FF94FAB416.description: Clarify and elaborate ideas based on feedback

520FFE7D600F463B87A0A1953B3E3A24.description: Act on feedback to revise understandings of how or why something works

209EC83B56B64A48AC1A8C20DE8FF86B.description: Compare and contrast objects or concepts

A48AB9B60A264FFA9F4CBDD1DBF1CB9C.description: Follow and describe cycles in diagrams, steps in procedures, or causes and effects

E7083D7036F84DFBAA618BC5DFD485FE.description: Summarize information from interaction with others and from learning experiences

2216D28916CF48F49A2CB59C2D0E6648.description: Define and classify objects or concepts

4383A91515004D08B070173B071C84A9.description: Discuss how stories might end or next steps

131D41665A2643C4AB88A33E959F0ABA.description: Ask questions about what others have shared

B8552970550C449093CCAAE54B5F02AB.description: Connect stories with images and representations to add meaning

BF2633E52CDF4A0BB80BAF3EF29D2971.description: Share ideas about one’s own and others’ lived experiences and previous learning
